description.narrative:
Stakeholders: Increased access to finance for underserved individuals. The Company will support underserved individuals in the country whose livelihoods were severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Project will increase access to finance to these low-income borrowers who need funds to rebuild their lives, maintain small businesses and meet medical expenses. Along with the proposed investment, IFC will also support women, who are underserved as they often do not possess credit history or other assets to use as a collateral. Once the borrower engages with MFL through gold loans or micro loans, the borrower is also introduced to other products such as vehicle loans and home loans that help borrowers access to finance into other areas as well.
Inclusiveness: Gold lending addresses a crucial financing gap for the underserved, who often do not possess credit history or other assets to use as collateral. This investment will help MFL to extend lending to the underserved segments and is expected to stimulate other players in the market to increase their financing for un/underbanked when the country needs support to recover from the COVID-19 crisis.

The proposed project is a senior secured loan of up to US$ 100 million in equivalent INR in the Company through subscription to non-convertible debentures (NCDs) to an existing IFC portfolio client, Manappuram Finance Limited (MFL or the Company), for a tenor of up to 3 years. The proposed project supports underserved individuals in the economy with focus on directing a portion of the debt towards women borrowers. MFL is a registered NBFC under the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) primarily offering gold loans, i.e., loans against pledge of gold jewelry. The Company was founded by Mr. V.C. Padmanabhan, father of current MD & CEO Mr. V.P. Nandakumar, in 1992 in Kerala. As on March 2022, MFL has consolidated assets under management (AUM) of INR 303bn (US$3.9bn) and a workforce of over 40,000. Its long-term debt is rated AA/stable by CRISIL.
